title: The chain story's gone! [Edit: It's back!]
content:
Damn! I just realised today I don't have that chain story from 2004 hosted at Spleen Keen any more, nor do I have a copy saved to my HDD. Please tell me someone kept a copy of it... it's quite an amusing story!

EDIT
I found it! Forgot my old site was jimsoftlair.tripod.com, not jimsoft.tripod.com.

Read it [url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/keen/community/chainstory.html]here[/url]! I'll be adding a link from Spleen Keen later. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: The chain story's gone!
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] Well, too bad I don't have it anywhere either.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: The chain story's gone!
content:
Woohoo!A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: The chain story's gone!
content:

Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
